title: Brexit insignificant globally says former Bank of England boss Lord King
text:
Brexit has dragged on too long and is preventing Government from addressing issues plaguing the economy, the former governor of the Bank of England Mervyn King warned.

In comments that clash with many economists’ warnings, Lord King said he did not think Brexit had “much significance even for the rest of Europe, let alone the rest of the world”, adding the issue has been “deeply corrosive” for society and the UK’s political system.

Speaking at the International Monetary Fund’s annual meetings in Washington, Lord King also said Brexit was getting in the way of tackling issues besetting the global economy, which is at risk of becoming engulfed in “a great stagnation”.
